statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.name: rebounds
statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.name: defensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.

statistics.name: offensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the offense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot.

article.description: Raekwon Miller scored 14 points, Drew Rackley added 13 and UNC Asheville cruised to a 92-60 victory over Division III Lees McRae on Monday night.
article.headline: UNC Asheville cruises past D-III Lees McRae 60, wins 92-60
article.linkText: UNC Asheville cruises past D-III Lees McRae 60, wins 92-60
article.story: ASHEVILLE, N.C. -- Raekwon Miller scored 14 points, Drew Rackley added 13 and UNC Asheville cruised to a 92-60 victory over Division III Lees McRae on Monday night. Miller made all three 3-point attempts and Rackley was 4-of-7 shooting and made a pair of 3-pointers. UNC Asheville (1-1) senior guard Kevin Vannatta added 11 points, and now has 938 career points. Jalen Seegars chipped in 10 points. Jordan Turner scored 12 points and Juwan Blanton had 10 for Lees McRae. The Bulldogs jumped out on a 24-14 spurt, capped by a Miller 3-pointer, and led 50-26 at halftime. Lees McRae pulled to 51-32 four minutes into the second half but didn't get closer. UNC Asheville led by 33 points with six minutes left and cruised from there. UNC Asheville bounced back from a 24-point loss to Rhode Island in its opener on Friday night, and faces Vanderbilt on Friday night.
